name: .LXV File Extension
summary: Learn about .LXV files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An LXV file is a file vault created by a Lexar JumpDrive Secure II. It contains one or more files that a user has stored in the vault. LXV files are password-protected to prevent unauthorized users from retrieving the files they contain.

content: The Lexar JumpDrive Secure II is a USB flash drive that allows users to encrypt and password-protect files stored on it. Users can encrypt files individually or store multiple files in a single password-protected vault. JumpDrive Secure II vaults are saved as LXV files, in the flash drive's Vaults directory.

When a user connects the JumpDrive Secure II to their computer, their LXV file appears as a separate drive on their computer (e.g., the F: drive). To access the files stored in an LXV file, or add files to the vault, a user must:
Connect their JumpDrive Secure II to their computer.
Use the device's Dashboard to mount their LXV file as a drive.
Enter the password associated with the LXV file.
Then, the LXV file will appear as a drive in Windows File Explorer or Apple Finder.

instructions: Ensure the file is stored on a Lexar JumpDrive Secure II. If it is not, you will not be able to open the file.
Connect your JumpDrive Secure II to your computer.
When the JumpDrive Secure II Dashboard appears, mount the drive that corresponds to your LXV file.
Then, you'll be able to access the files your LXV file contains, from the newly-mounted drive that appears in Windows File Explorer or Apple Finder.
